briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the identifier. The identifier is a unique key used by CM_JobManager to reference individual jobs.
Gets a value indicating whether this CM_Job is running.
Gets a value indicating whether this CM_Job is paused.
Gets a value indicating whether this CM_Job job was killed or was allowed to complete.

detaileddescription.para: true if job killed; otherwise, false.

briefdescription.para: Gets a value indicating whether this CM_Job is repeating.
Gets the number of times this job has been executed.
Gets the coroutine of this job.
Gets the child jobs as an array.
Occurs when job started.
Occurs when job paused.
Occurs when job resumed.
Occurs when job complete.
Occurs when child jobs started.
Occurs when child jobs complete.
Occurs when job finished running. This is useful when a job has been set to repeat and you would like to be informed when all repeat jobs have finished.
The of child jobs.
Holds a clone of the coroutine. Used to repeat the routine if CM_Job.repeating is true.
Used to repeat the routine a set number of times, if CM_Job.repeating is true.
Initializes a new instance of the CM_Job class.
Returns an initialised CM_Job instance. Provides static access to class.
Returns an initialised CM_Job instance with the specified id. Provides static access to class.
Builds the specified coroutines into CM_Job instances.
Clone this instance.
Clone this instance.
Start this instance. Runs the coroutine immediately.
Start the specified instance after delayInSeconds. The coroutine is added to CM_Dispatcher job queue to be executed in the next timestep as a coroutine cannot be started in a seperate thread.

parameterdescription.para: Delay in secods until instance is processed.

briefdescription.para: Sets this instance to repeat. The job is repeated when it has finished processing.
Sets this instance to repeat. The job is repeated a set number of times.
Stops the repeat after a specified delay in seconds.
Pause this instance.
Pause the specified instance after delayInSeconds.

parameterdescription.para: Delay in secods until instance is paused.

briefdescription.para: Resume this instance.
Resume the specified instance after delayInSeconds.

parameterdescription.para: Delay in secods until instance is resumed.

briefdescription.para: Kill this instance. Stops the running coroutine.
Kill this instance. Stops the running coroutine after delayInSeconds.

parameterdescription.para: Delay in seconds until instance killed.

briefdescription.para: Adds a child job.
Create a new job using the provided Enumerator and adds as a child job.
Removes a child job if present.
Subscribes to the jobFinishedRunning event

parameterdescription.para: The eventhandler to be invoked on event.

briefdescription.para: Unsubscribes to the jobFinishedRunning event

parameterdescription.para: The eventhandler to be invoked on event.

briefdescription.para: Subscribes to the jobStarted event.

parameterdescription.para: The eventhandler to be invoked on event.

briefdescription.para: Unsubscribes to the jobStarted event.
Subscribes to the job paused event.
Unsubscribes to the job paused event.
Subscribes to the job resumed event.
Unsubscribes to the job resumed event.
Subscribes to the the jobComplete event.

parameterdescription.para: The eventhandler to be invoked on event.

briefdescription.para: Unsubscribes to the the jobComplete event.
Subscribes to the the childJobsStarted event.

parameterdescription.para: The eventhandler to be invoked on event.

briefdescription.para: Unsubscribes to the the childJobsStarted event.
Subscribes to the the childJobsComplete event.

parameterdescription.para: The eventhandler to be invoked on event.

briefdescription.para: Unsubscribes to the the childJobsComplete event.
Raises the job finished running event.
Raises the job started event.
Raises the job complete event.
Raises the job paused event.
Raises the job resumed event.
Raises the child jobs started event.
Raises the child jobs complete event.
The main coroutine job class. Encapsulates the behaviour for a single coroutine job. Provides access to status (i.e. running, paused, killed etc),
